definitions.definition: the feeling or belief that one can rely on someone or something; firm trust.
examples: we had every confidence in the staff
synonyms: conviction "I have little confidence in these figures"

definitions.definition: the state of feeling certain about the truth of something.
examples: it is not possible to say with confidence how much of the increase in sea levels is due to melting glaciers

definitions.definition: a feeling of self-assurance arising from one's appreciation of one's own abilities or qualities.
the telling of private matters or secrets with mutual trust.
examples: someone with whom you may raise your suspicions in confidence

definitions.definition: a secret or private matter told to someone under a condition of trust.
